result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Michael Mitchem is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Michael Mitchem was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with 12CF1730 & 21CF1731, with credit for 58 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: - Maintain work and/or school or participate in job search and/or job training.
- No contact with any Meijer Stores in the State of Wisconsin.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments.
- Absolute sobriety with random testing.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders restitution set at $0.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges.   
Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency. As to mandatory costs, surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections. Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Michael Mitchem

defendant.name: Mitchem, Anthony Michael

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing proceeded on this case and with cases 21CF1730 & 22CF1251.
State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 24 MONTHS (CONCURRENT WITH 21CF1730 & 21CF1731), with credit for 58 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  
The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS ELIGIBLE for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".  

Court orders the following conditions of extended supervision: 
 
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- maintain work and/or school or participate in job search and/or job training
- no contact with any Meijer Stores in the State of Wisconsin

Court orders restitution set at $0.
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges.   
Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.  As to mandatory costs, surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect prison funds at an amount or percentage deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections.  Remaining balance to be collected during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;

Defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem in court. Defendant in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Anthony Michael Mitchem.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski for  James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.
As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed. 
Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.

Defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Anthony Michael Mitchem.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski for James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Case called on defense request for reasons stated on the record.  Defendant now informs the court that he does wish to proceed with the plea and sentencing.  Matter to be held this afternoon.

Defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Anthony Michael Mitchem.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment. Court grants. Case set in Branch 37 spin court for 9-12-22 1:30 pm. Parties advised.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Michael Mitchem
Current: 155 E Johnson Ave, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 04-03-2022)
Prior: 3344 Marina Road #214, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Meijer Wauwatosa; Gerry M.C.; Fritz T.T.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Anthony Michael Mitchem in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Michael Mitchem appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
